abstract: Although it is successful for some, most melanoma patients are refractory to T cell checkpoint inhibition. In this issue of Immunity, Merad and colleagues (2016) describe a dendritic-cell-based strategy to heighten the efficacy of therapeutic anti-PD-L1 and BRAF inhibitors in mouse melanoma models.
title: Revving Up Dendritic Cells while Braking PD-L1 to Jump-Start the Cancer-Immunity Cycle Motor.
